programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The 1973 Toyota Celica, the first generation of this iconic model. Mike finds a powerful solution for a rough running engine. Meanwhile, Ant is in the workshop, putting his fabrication skills to the test.

programme.desc: The Ghouls attempt to finish the 45-day restoration of a 1970 Road Runner, owned by tool creator Mark Martinez, who can't wait to take it for its first drive.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Known for its sizzling performance and smooth body style, the '69 Pontiac GTO is one of the fastest cars of its time. Now, Joe gives it his signature twist with rad body mods and new power train that will have its super wide tires smokin' hot.

programme.title: Garage Squad
programme.desc: Ron's classic 1967 Plymouth Barracuda needs a motor, trans lines, and a lot of work under the hood. Recovering from recent heart surgery, only the Garage Squad can give Ron the help he needs to get this monster of Mopar back together again.

programme.title: Garage Squad
programme.desc: Danielle's 1968 Chevy Camaro 327 convertible was her dream car, but now it's her nightmare needing an overhaul from bumper to bumper. She lost all hope.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: On this episode, watch Tony Angelo, Lucky Costa and guest Lindsay Ross transform a banged-up 1987 Chevrolet G10 work van into a 1977 Boogie Van clone.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Lucky Costa's personal '66 Chevelle gets major upgrades to its 6.0L LS truck engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave finds an amazing deal for a rare VW Transporter pickup that is too good to pass up. His real dilemma, whether to keep it or auction it, begins after the modifications are complete.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The owners of a run down '63 Grumman bread truck want it transformed into the ultimate t-shirt vending machine. Bill and the guys drop the giant truck to the floor with custom body modifications and a bar themed interior.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Arthur bought his Cyclone new in 1967, but then his father put 400,000 miles on it. Now, he wants FantomWorks to make it better than new. Antonio and his cousin Andres challenge Dan to build the fastest Mustang CS in Mexico.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: FantomWorks finish the build of the ultimate Mustang Sleeper for Antonio and Andres: a California Special powered by a Coyote Aluminator. Phil wants a 1949 Chevy Pick-up like the one he rode in as a child, but the truck is a disassembled jigsaw puzzle.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: David is a Volkswagen fanatic who wants to outmatch muscle cars with a 1967 Beetle. FantomWorks will have to undo the bad repairs from at least three fiberglass rending accidents to give Robert the widened 1967 Corvette supercar he wants.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Tom asks Dan to find him a rare 1967 Camaro Convertible with factory AC, but once found, this Unicorn is too good to cut up. Dave wants Dan to build a safe, almost all stock '71 Datsun, but the car's badly damaged from previous restoration work.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Sean asks Dan to find a 1969 Camaro that can be built into the custom resto-mod of his dreams. Jeff wants to give his 1969 Cutlass a rare Hurst makeover, but the engine has never run and there are more parts in boxes than on the car.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Dave traded for his dream '57 Corvette over three decades ago, but his plans to build it have, so far, come to nothing. Ken picked a rare 1954 Kaiser Darrin from his father's collection, he now it's on FantomWorks to reverse the hands of time.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Larry wants to drive his uncle's prized '59 Cadillac DeVille, but the car has spent decades baking in the AZ sun. Brian spent years gathering parts to restore his grandfather's 1960 Bel Air only to find that he's still missing more critical components.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin take the '67 Coronet, '55 Gullwing and '63 Corvette to a car show in Chicago, where they'll compete for street rod of the year. The cars need to complete a road course and be judged on the appointments of the build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A big Impala guy from Houston wants to take the old shell of a '66 C-10 and combine it with the best of a 60's Impala. It's a one of a kind, from the ground up build with a completely hand-built chassis, body mods, 6.2L engine, and a hydraulic bed.

programme.title: Garage Squad
programme.desc: Ron's classic 1967 Plymouth Barracuda needs a motor, trans lines, and a lot of work under the hood. Recovering from recent heart surgery, only the Garage Squad can give Ron the help he needs to get this monster of Mopar back together again.

programme.title: Garage Squad
programme.desc: The Squad tries to help a father running short on time and money bring his Triumph back to life.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: Fred and Dave blow the cobwebs off of two of their favorite muscle cars, the Mad Maxxis and the Dirt Pacer. They'll head to the Motor City of Detroit for some urban off-roading.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: When Fred buys an International Scout with a camper on top, it's time for an adventure. But first, he and Dave head to Anything Scout to fix up the old overlander and transform it into a trail machine with a house on the back.

programme.title: Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve visits Cadillac King and uncovers a massive '68 Fleetwood and a '75 Calais six-door limo. He'll also try to bust the notion that all Caddys are gigantic with a '79 Seville Milan roadster and a '93 Allante.

programme.title: Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: Steve delivers a lesson about the birds and bees -- Plymouth Road Runners and Dodge Super Bees. In a private yard, he finds what might be the very last Super Bee of all, along with a Road Runner with colors fit for 'The King.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Body work and paint can be intimidating, but Roadkill Garage's Steve Dulcich has no fear of hammers, dual-action sanders or body filler. He gears up and attacks David Freiburger's 1970 Plymouth known as the Crop Duster.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crop Duster is a back-to-basics street and strip machine with big-block power. It's running its quickest quarter mile ever, running in the 11s in no-prep track conditions.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: John Andrade Jr. from Street Outlaws joins the guys in a messy battle, when a '75 dirt-track Camaro goes head-to-head with a big-block-powered Toyota mud truck on a makeshift drag strip down the center of a mud park.

programme.title: Garage Squad
programme.desc: Restoring a Split Window Corvette runs into unexpected problems. The owner of a '63 Corvette never had time or money to keep it running. After dozens of swap meets searching for the parts to rebuild the car, he's still nowhere close.

programme.title: GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey preps the Stunt Double's bed with fender flairs, a roll bar and some blazing spotlights to keep that 'Fall Guy' look with a modern twist. Then, it's on to the Gladiator build, where Stacey makes sure the search and rescue rig can see in the dark.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne resurrects a 1962 Jaguar XKE SI 3.8 Flat Floor Roadster once owned by Today Show host, Dave Garroway. And what do an OSCA MT4 race car, a million-dollar 8-liter Bentley and a questionable '71 Siata Spring have in common? Carini of course.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: The guys head to Angelo's shop in Pennsylvania for an insane project, cramming an entire second drivetrain into the rear of a Chevy Impala. Then it's off to a drag strip in New Jersey to put their creation through its paces.

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: Dennis makes his way to the Highlands Motoring Festival in North Carolina. Plus, he talks weatherstripping solutions for a variety of applications.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The Overhaulin' team has pulled off the ultimate prank: stealing Chip Foose's beloved '56 truck right out from under his nose and overhauled it over the course of four months! A new side of Chip is revealed as the prankster gets pranked.(c)

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Andy's vision for big ideas leads to a huge opportunity for the shop. If he pulls off the build as promised, he could secure future business for years to come. And with a little help from his dad, he has the opportunity to boost his own collection.(c)

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys find out the hard way what happens when they put a 6.2 liter supercharged Hellcrate engine in a '73 Challenger. When the factory rear end blows up, they swap it out for an upgrade with the right gear setup.(c)

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls help a Mustang owner with a spinal cord injury finish some interior parts on his classic Mustang. They also properly hang the mufflers and add some new rear shocks.(c)

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian needs a new FourWheeler shop truck, but he doesn't just buy new trucks, he builds them. So he'll tear down a two-door Dodge Dakota and turn it into a custom tools-carrying monster.(c)

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Tony and Lucky jump headfirst into the dirt-track world. They scoop up an old, beat-up Nova, drop a basic 350 in it, and take it to compete on a super-fast half-mile oval in Selinsgrove, Pennsylvania.(c)

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: Matt and Bruno have a new LJ Jeep in the shop to get some performance goodies and other cool styling options. Matt thinks it's a good idea to put it through the mud, but Bruno is not so sure. He thinks it's more of a Mall Crawler than a Mud Crawler.(c)

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Automotive experts share their expertise on a variety of automotive tech issues.(c)

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe finds a pristine '62 Impala owned by a customer who wants to cut it up, strip it back, and add more horses than a TX ranch. But money troubles threaten the build, leaving the future of the job in limbo.(c)

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe gets his hands on a sweet '67 Chevy Nova, and the crew has some mods in store that hit harder than a Lone Star Linebacker. But all great work comes at a cost. Shag and Amanda need to find a buyer with deep pockets, fast.(c)

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: When a customer turns up at Martin Bros Customs with a '59 Impala, it looks more like a parts donor than a serious project. But Joe Martin can't turn down a car with this classic style and comes up with a rad plan.(c)

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The team tears into a '62 Chevy truck. Joe wants to create a custom lowrider so radical it scrapes the ground and includes new air-ride suspension, tray, front end and a killer paint job. The race is on as the clock ticks and money burns.(c)

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and his gang serve up some West Coast cool, resurrecting a 1953 Ford Ranch wagon and turning it into a bad-ass beach cruiser. A heart stopping shop accident and a race to repaint a client's custom built bike could turn this dream into a nightmare.(c)

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe has big plans for one of his favorite cars, a '64 Lincoln Continental. He wants it long and low and the color of snow. But a faulty steering column and a close call in the shop threatens to turn this quick flip into a never-ending money pit.(n)

programme.desc: Cooking instructor Ron Maestri shows us how to cook for lobster taste on a tunafish budget. Rocker Goldy Locks converted an abandoned hospital into her home, for just the fraction of the price.(c)

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: When Dennis quit drinking, a new compulsion took over, hoarding, and he is now in severe debt. Monte has accumulated a massive, couture-clothing hoard, and destroyed a relationship with her son.(c)

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: After 30 years of hoarding, Gary's house is so full that he is forced to sleep outside on a makeshift bed.(c)

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: A family suffers the effects of mould, mice and flea infestations because their upstairs neighbor and landlord has acquired one of the show's most massive hoards to date.(c)

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: One mother's battle with hoarding is overshadowed by the discovery of her own daughter's compulsion to hold on to things, while another mother is putting her family's unity on the line and her husband's life at risk with her own extreme hoarding problem.(c)

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Property investors get more than they bargained for when the house they purchased is occupied by hoarder Michelle and a rat infestation so bad, it has compromised the building's foundation.(c)

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: A compulsive hoarder and Elvis impersonator spends his days collecting Elvis memorabilia, which has left his apartment virtually uninhabitable.(c)

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Jackson meets baby Lilah, and everyone is surprised by his reaction. Tori struggles with her recovery from the C-section, while Matt and Caryn find new ways to entertain little Jackson. Then, Amy and Chris move one step closer to moving in together.(n)

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Actress Laurel is on tour with the musical 'Wicked,' and she wants a dress that doesn't resemble her stage costumes. Picky bride Kea has already tried on more than 100 dresses! Mackenzie worries her beach dress will be too short to cover her bare feet.(n)

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Whytnee wants a sexy dress to suit her vixen image, Carla wants to show more skin than her mother would like, and 52-years-young Dina is ready to try on her gown, saying it will fit right if it fits tight.(n)

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristin is torn between looking sexy or traditional. Alexa also wants a dress with sex appeal, but she needs to please her conservative dad. Diana can't decide between a flowy or structured gown.(n)

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate human remains found at a neighbourhood block party. Suburban politics and secret scandals give each neighbour in the cul-de-sac a motive, leaving Brennan, Booth and Sweets to sift through the drama to find their suspect.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth are called to investigate what appears to be charred human remains on an electrical fence. The mysterious corpse is later determined to be a mummified Egyptian royal, but the mystery deepens when a curator is murdered.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Pride is spotted tracking one of Mayor Hamilton's accomplices, the suspect opens fire on a crowded street before disappearing.

programme.desc: While Pride remains on probation six weeks after his rogue takedown of the corrupt Mayor Hamilton, his team is closely monitored. Also, when the FBI arrives to run lead on a case involving a stolen rig of nuclear waste the team must investigate.(c)
